titleStmt.title: Willis White to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG4743

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Clinton Ky March 9th 1864
To His Excellency
Thos. E. Bramlette
Gov State of kentucky
Dr Sir

At the December (1863) term of the Hickman Co Court, I, as Judge of Said Court, Granted to Jno Titsworth, tavern license to keep a tavern in the town of Clinton, and included in Said license, permission to keep a bar in a room, across the street and detached from the tavern building. For keeping Said tippling House, he was indicted and fined, at the late February term of the Hickman Circuit Court, in the Sum of Sixty Dollars.

The reason why I gave Said license and also permission to keep Said bar in manner as above Stated, is, that Judge R. K. Williams, formerly Circuit Judge of this district, had decided that the law gives to County Judges that power.

I think it hard that Mr Titsworth Should have to pay the fine, as, if he was guilty of any offense against the law, it was through ignorance and under the impression that he had satisfied the laws and that impression made by the nature of his license. Now if you care, with consistence
in your official duties, remit Said fine, I think it will be nothing more than Justice to Mr Titsworth

Most respectfully
Your obt Servant
Willis White
Judge Hickman Co. Court

Hickman Cir Ct
vs
John Titsworth
$60 --
Remit all except fees
& costs
Tho E Bramlette
Tipling
14th Mch 1864
